topic.title: Return an Isolated UPS to a Redundant UPS System

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Return an Isolated UPS to a Redundant UPS System

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Steps to safely return an isolated UPS unit back into a redundant UPS arrangement: reconnect, resynchronize, validate load sharing, and run acceptance tests.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: isolated UPS unit;parallel communications bus;transfer switch;load-sharing controller;bypass feeder

context.note: Check that the other UPS in the redundant UPS system is working correctly with no pending alarms and can supply the load by itself.

li.p: On the isolated UPS, check that:
Coupling switch Q694 for UPS2 or Q692 for UPS1 is open (if present).
Battery switch Q201 and/or Q211 is open.
Switch Q601 is in position AUTO.
Close the rectifier mains input switch Q001.
Close the battery switch Q201 (Q211)The system can have one internal battery switch Q201, or one battery switch Q211, or both..
Close the bypass mains input switch Q501. The display will turn on after 10 seconds.

stepresult.note: If the system is programmed for AUTOSTART it will start automatically after 60s if the rectifier mains input switch Q001 is closed and the input voltage is within tolerance.

li.p: Press the ON button on the display.
Check that the UPS is functioning correctly and that there are no alarms pending.
Press the ON and the OFF buttons simultaneously on the display. The UPS will shut down with no voltage on the output.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: hazard of electric shock, explosion, or arc flash
messagepanel.howtoavoid: After this operation, power will still be present on the power connection terminals. Ensure that the protection covers are installed.

li.p: Close coupling switch Q694 for UPS2 or Q692 for UPS1 (if present).
Press the ON button on the display.
li.stepresult: The load is supplied by both UPS units in redundant operation with load sharing.
